main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed in the vicinity of Cascade Cove, Manitou Springs, Colorado, on 8 August 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as bell-shaped and silver in color, approximately 20 feet above a ridge, and seemed to hang in the air in one spot for about three minutes.
The witness estimated the object to be about one and a half feet in diameter with no observable maneuvering, lights, color, sound, or exhaust.
Detailed weather conditions at the time were provided, showing unlimited ceiling and visibility, and no observable celestial phenomena or planets in the vicinity.
The altitude of the object was estimated to be approximately 10,500 feet above sea level, and the witness was facing the object at the time of sighting.
Extensive investigations failed to reveal the object or anyone else who had seen it, but the possibility of a weather balloon entering the area was considered.
result: prozaic explanation - the object was concluded to be a balloon, possibly from the US weather bureau in Denver.
witnesses: The witness was a 57-year-old individual who was considered a reliable person, although a talkative individual, and was wearing bifocal glasses.
